subject: A Few Quick Thoughts
event:
I am off to Baltimore tomorrow for Balticon 50, which promises to be a real blast.   In honor of half a century of great cons, the fans of Baltimore are bringing in lots and lots of their past GOHs, along with me, their current GOH, so we should have an amazing crowd on hand.  Connie Willis, Joe Haldeman, John Varley... oh, the list goes on and on.  Go to the Balticon website and see for your own self.  And then come to the con.  Panels, readings, parties... and there will be CRABS.

<lj-embed id="738"/>

On other fronts... we had an amazing time at the Jean Cocteau last night, when a sellout crowd assembled to hear Joe Hill.  Joe gave a dynamite reading from his new novel THE FIREMAN, led the audience in a kazoo concert, told us about all his forthcoming television and film projects, and signed stacks and stacks of books.  Most of which were promptly carried off by his eager fans.  But we did lay in extra supplies, so if you're looking for autographed copies of THE FIREMAN, or HEART-SHAPED BOX, or LOCKE & KEY, or any of Joe's stuff, it's available -- while the supply lasts -- from the Jean Cocteau Bookshop at http://www.jeancocteaubooks.com/ -- along with signed books from Neil Gaiman, Stephen Graham Jones, Diana Gabaldon, Joe Lansdale, and many many more.

Heated discussions continue about this year's Hugo ballot, and the various proposals being brought forth to reform the voting procedures to defend the integrity of the award against future attacks by Rabid Puppies and other varieties of fuggheads.  Some of the proposals are worth considering.  I have severe doubts about others.  But I don't have time to get into all of that now, so it will have to wait until I return.

Meanwhile, I am doing my Hugo reading, and I urge all of you who are members of Big MAC II to do the same.   Read, consider, vote.  

And if you're not yet a member of Big MAC II... well, if there's any chance at all that you can get to KC this August, you ought to join and attend.  There's nothing like a worldcon.  And the original Big MAC in 1976 was, in my not-so-humble-opinion, the best worldcon that I've ever had the pleasure of attending, so I have high hopes for this year's.  The KC fans know how to party.  And while they cannot match Baltimore for crabs, they do have BARBEQUE!

(I will keep comments open on this one only through tomorrow morning.  I expect to be away from my computer while traveling, and don't want hundreds of screened comments awaiting my return).

comments.article: Argh, I was nearly going to come but sadly not. Some of my friends from the ASoIaF Facebook Group will be there. They have promised to be on their best behaviour. Well, almost :)

comments.upictitle: Names Is For Tombstones, Baby: Rocketeer
comments.article: See you in Baltimore, George!
Look forward to it.  Will there be a Valley Forge party?

A few folks from Ice & Fire Con will be at Balticon and the r/asoiaf meet up! Excited to hear about their experiences there. Also, we have picked the dates for next year's Ice & Fire Con: April 28-30, 2017
comments.subject: Balticon love from Ice & Fire Con

comments.article: Are you giving a speech? If so, do you know if it will be made available online?
An interview.

Have fun! We have a whole group of ASOIAF reddit fans planning to attend. We're all looking forward to seeing you. If you stay off the main drag, look at a place like Nick's Fish House for some of the best crabs in the city.

I hope this is on-topic, but John Picacio mentioned on twiter that you were reading a brand new chapter from WINDS that you haven't read or released previously. Without spoiling anything, I wonder whether you might say whether this was true or not?

Regardless, you'll have a blast. Weather looks to be beautiful out here while you're here!
comments.subject: Have fun!

comments.article: Well, I am reading something... haven't decided what yet.
comments.subject: Re: Have fun!

comments.article: There's going to be a podcasting panel there held by some great ASOIAF podcasters (Radio Westeros, History of Westeros). You should show up and ask them some questions - may I recommend "who is your favorite character?" and "why are your podcasts so violent?"
Safe travels! Enjoy all the seafood in Baltimore.

Since you mentioned MAC II (WorldCon) memberships and Balticon ... MAC II asked staff to help promote this special offer. So, I'm linking it here for convenience. Perfect timing, George! I hope it is okay with you to post this here. :-)

http://midamericon2.org/memorial-day/

Memorial Day Membership Offer!

This weekend only, we are offering a special Weekend (Fri-Sun) Pass* for $150, or for just $50 more you can purchase a Full Attending Membership (Wed-Sun) which gives you two more days of programming and events, ability to attend the Retro Hugo Swing Dance plus voting rights for the Hugo Awards and the option to vote for the location of 2018 Worldcon!

This offer will be available online (and in person at ConQuest and Balticon) Friday through Monday.

*Weekend passes do not include Hugo Award or Site Selection Voting rights.
Sir, when is your panel/session this weekend? Balticon has not published schedule and my wife and I are trying to arrange childcare. Thanks for all you do!
comments.subject: Schedule

comments.article:
Friday I will be at opening ceremonies 7pm to 9 pm.

Saturday we have a 10:30 am signing, and an interview at 1:30pm, and a 3:30 panel with John Picacio.

Sunday another signing at 10:30 am, the liar's panel at 1:00pm, and a reading at 3:15.

Monday I have a kaffeeklatch at 11:30 (advance signup required).
comments.subject: Re: Schedule

comments.article:
Meanwhile, I am doing my Hugo reading, and I urge all of you who are members of Big MAC II to do the same. Read, consider, vote.
I'm in way too deep on the voting-mechanics discussions, but this is really so important, and can't be repeated often enough. In March I nominated for the first time, and I love how immensely it changed my reading patterns - to brand new stuff, to constant discovery, to always having other people to discuss books with and trade recommendations with.

If anybody's interested in beefing up their short story reading, and having somebody to chat with about 'em, I've set up a little short story club on Facebook; all for stories from the myriad free and excellent ezines. We're always happy for new participants :)

Hi George-

Quick question for you... What does one call a follower of the Faith of the Seven? (i.e. Methodist Church = Methodist, Islam = Muslim)

Have fun at Balticon!
comments.subject: Faith of the Seven

comments.article: Never thought about it.
comments.subject: Re: Faith of the Seven

comments.article: Someday if / when you announce you're coming to Milwaukee I'll be the first in line. No better place to enjoy an ice cold beer, and it seems you might need one!

comments.subject: Balticon

comments.article:
Another con, another comment from me pushing for a chapter from Fire & Blood rather than The Winds of Winter. I love hearing you read regardless, but I figure it's worth mentioning on the chance that I'll actually get to hear a chapter from Fire & Blood.

This will be the first con that I'm a panelist at (on 3 ASOIAF panels), which is both exciting and a little nerve-wracking. Do you remember the first panel you were on?

Oh, yes.

Took me years. In those days there was but a single track of programming, so panel slots were hard to come by. I actually had to win a Hugo before I was considered panel-worthy (losing a Hugo, the Campbell, and two Nebulas was not enough).

And when I did get on a panel, it was one called "the New Writers Panel." Where I remained for the better part of the decade, often with the same group of co-panelists. "Round up the usual new writers," they must have said.
Does House Baelish have house words?
comments.subject: House Words

comments.article:
Want amazing seafood.. including crabs, go to Cantler's... thank me later. ;)

Enjoy B'more and try not to get abducted by ASOIAF FANatics! LOL!
comments.subject: Go to Cantler's

comments.article: Can't wait to meet you at Balticon. Remember to enjoy some Old Bay on those crabs!
comments.subject: Balticon

Very important question before you head to Baltimore.

Do you think Joe Flacco is a elite quarterback?
comments.subject: Baltimore

comments.article: He's no Eli Manning.
comments.subject: Re: Baltimore

comments.article: Occasions like this make me think of moving to the US. Have fun, and if you can please provide us with a link of your interview afterwards!
the crab people song tho <3 have a safe trip

I'm really bummed I couldn't make it. I'm over on the western side of West Virginia and this is about the closest convention to me. Only a few hours away, after all. Alas, prior commitments just didn't allow for me to come. I was really hoping to make this my first convention. Maybe I'll get to do one as a writer someday soon and that will force my hand.

I knew you'd be there. Then I come to find out a lot of my favorites from the ASoIaF subreddit are going to meet up (Even BryndenBFish). I really dropped the ball on this one. I might just say "fuck it" and make WorldCon my first con in KC later this year. We'll see how it goes.

Still, I hope you and everyone else has a fun time this weekend. I can't wait to read about it on here once you get back.
I'm very excited to be coming in for the Con this weekend. Hopefully I will be able to get one of the tickets to have an autograph done and of course some crabs. :D
comments.subject: Balticon50

comments.article:
Hi Sir,

A while back, I saw your ALS ice bucket challenge with Neil Gaiman, and it made me giddy that I lived in a universe where two of my favorite authors were actual friends. Since then, I've always wanted to ask Mr. Gaiman which work of yours was his favorite and to ask you if you've ever had a chance to read his Sandman series or if there was perhaps another work of his you enjoyed most.

I also have one very important ASOIAF question to ask: Of all the direwolves, which is your favorite?

Thank you!
comments.subject: Neil Gaiman?
